thread.title: Steve Irwin: WATCH The Crocodile Hunter’s best bits on his 55th birthday
thread.title_full: Steve Irwin: WATCH The Crocodile Hunter’s best bits on his 55th birthday

title: Steve Irwin: WATCH The Crocodile Hunter’s best bits on his 55th birthday
text:
However, his son Robert is now following in his father’s footsteps and even appeared on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon recently and brought along a large python. 
The 13-year-old was seen getting to the grips with the large reptile as the US chat show host exclaimed: “It’s so cool to see you like this! You’re actually like your dad!” 
On what would have been his 55th birthday, we take a look back at his five best moments. GETTY The Crocodile Hunter Steve Irwin would have been 55 today 
1. The time he got bitten on the nose by a bearded dragon 
In the hilarious 30-second clip, Steve was heard calling the small lizard “cantankerous” and “cranky” and it appeared that the small reptile took issue with his words and gave him a little nip. 
Steve was heard exclaiming: “You little brat!” 
2. The time he got chased by a giant bird 
He handled some of the most deadly animals on the planet but there were times when he found himself up against some less dangerous ones. 
Half-way through this video montage, Steve is seen trying to run away from a giant bird chasing him through the bush. 
3. Dealing with the world’s deadliest snake 
In one of the most famous clips of Steve, the naturalist was seen taking on one of the most dangerous snakes in the world. 
He was seen grabbing the Inland Taipan by the tail and explaining to viewers how venomous it was. 
4. When he was got getting preened by a stork 
In a rather exasperating filming session, Steve had to do numerous takes as he kept getting pecked by a stork. 
It turned out that the bird mistook him for a fellow feathered friend and was trying to preen him. David Attenborough's Planet Earth II Mon, November 28, 2016
